verses.verse: Moreover the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> came to me<WH559>, saying,

Go<WH1980> and cry<WH7121> in the ears<WH241> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, saying<WH559>, Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>; I remember<WH2142> you<WH2617>, the kindness of your youth<WH5271>, the love<WH160> of your espousals<WH3623>, when you went<WH3212> after<WH310> me in the wilderness<WH4057>, in a land<WH776> that was not sown<WH2232>.

Israel<WH3478> was holiness<WH6944> unto the Lord<WH3068>, and the firstfruits<WH7225> of his increase<WH8393>: all that devour<WH398> him shall offend<WH816>; evil<WH7451> shall come<WH935> upon them<WH5002>, says the Lord<WH3068>.
Hear<WH8085> you the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068>, O house<WH1004> of Jacob<WH3290>, and all the families<WH4940> of the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478>:

Thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>, What iniquity<WH5766> have your fathers<WH1> found<WH4672> in me<WH7368>, that they are gone far from me<WH3212>, and have walked after<WH310> vanity<WH1892>, and are become vain<WH1891>?

Neither said<WH559> they<WH3068>, Where is the Lord that brought us up<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, that led<WH3212> us through the wilderness<WH4057>, through a land<WH776> of deserts<WH6160> and of pits<WH7745>, through a land<WH776> of drought<WH6723>, and of the shadow of death<WH6757>, through a land<WH776> that no man<WH376> passed through<WH5674>, and where no man<WH120> lived<WH3427>?

And I brought<WH935> you into a plentiful<WH3759> country<WH776>, to eat<WH398> the fruit<WH6529> there and the goodness<WH2898> there<WH935>; but when you entered, you defiled<WH2930> my land<WH776>, and made<WH7760> my heritage<WH5159> an abomination<WH8441>.

The priests<WH3548> said<WH559> not<WH3068>, Where is the Lord? and they that handle<WH8610> the law<WH8451> knew<WH3045> me not<WH7462>: the pastors also transgressed<WH6586> against me<WH5030>, and the prophets prophesied<WH5012> by Baal<WH1168>, and walked<WH1980> after<WH310> things that do not profit<WH3276>.
Therefore I will yet plead<WH7378> with you<WH5002>, says the Lord<WH3068>, and with your children<WH1121>'s sons<WH1121> will I plead<WH7378>.
For pass over<WH5674> the islands<WH339> of Chittim<WH3794>, and see<WH7200>; and send<WH7971> unto Kedar<WH6938>, and consider<WH995> diligently<WH3966>, and see if there be such a thing<WH7200>.
Has a nation<WH1471> changed<WH3235> their gods<WH430>, which are yet no gods<WH430>? but my people<WH5971> have changed<WH4171> their glory<WH3519> for that which does not profit<WH3276>.
Be astonished<WH8074>, O you heavens<WH8064>, at this<WH8175>, and be horribly afraid, be you very<WH3966> desolate<WH2717>, says<WH5002> the Lord<WH3068>.

For my people<WH5971> have committed<WH6213> two<WH8147> evils<WH7451>; they have forsaken<WH5800> me the fountain<WH4726> of living<WH2416> waters<WH4325>, and hewed them out<WH2672> cisterns<WH877>, broken<WH7665> cisterns<WH877>, that can hold<WH3557> no water<WH4325>.
Is Israel<WH3478> a servant<WH5650>? is he a homeborn<WH1004> slave<WH4069>? why has he become prey<WH957>?
The young lions<WH3715> roared<WH7580> upon him<WH5414>, and yelled, and they made<WH7896> his land<WH776> waste<WH8047>: his cities<WH5892> are burned<WH3341> without inhabitant<WH3427>.
Also the sons<WH1121> of Noph<WH5297> and Tahapanes<WH8471> have broken<WH7462> the crown of your head<WH6936>.
Have you not procured<WH6213> this unto yourself<WH5800>, in that you have forsaken the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>, when<WH6256> he led<WH3212> you by the way<WH1870>?

And now what have you to do in the way<WH1870> of Egypt<WH4714>, to drink<WH8354> the waters<WH4325> of Sihor<WH7883>? or what have you to do in the way<WH1870> of Assyria<WH804>, to drink<WH8354> the waters<WH4325> of the river<WH5104>?

Your own wickedness<WH7451> shall correct<WH3256> you<WH4878>, and your backslidings shall reprove<WH3198> you<WH3045>: know therefore and see<WH7200> that it is a evil<WH7451> thing and bitter<WH4751>, that you have forsaken<WH5800> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>, and that my fear<WH6345> is not in you<WH5002>, says the Lord<WH136> God<WH3069> of hosts<WH6635>.

For of old time<WH5769> I have broken<WH7665> your yoke<WH5923>, and burst<WH5423> your bands<WH4147>; and you said<WH559>, I will not transgress<WH5674>; when upon every high<WH1364> hill<WH1389> and under every green<WH7488> tree<WH6086> you wander<WH6808>, playing the prostitute<WH2181>.
Yet I had planted<WH5193> you a noble vine<WH8321>, wholly a right<WH571> seed<WH2233>: how then are you turned<WH2015> into the degenerate plant<WH5494> of a strange<WH5237> vine unto me<WH1612>?
For though you wash<WH3526> yourself with soda<WH5427>, and use much<WH7235> soap<WH1287>, yet your iniquity<WH5771> is marked<WH3799> before<WH6440> me<WH5002>, says the Lord<WH136> God<WH3069>.

How can you say<WH559>, I am not polluted<WH2930>, I have not gone<WH1980> after<WH310> Baalim<WH1168>? see<WH7200> your way<WH1870> in the valley<WH1516>, know<WH3045> what you have done<WH6213>: you are a swift<WH7031> dromedary<WH1072> traversing<WH8308> her ways<WH1870>;

A wild donkey<WH6501> used<WH3928> to the wilderness<WH4057>, that snuffs up<WH7602> the wind<WH7307> at her pleasure<WH185>; in her occasion<WH8385> who can turn her away<WH7725>? all they that seek<WH1245> her will not weary<WH3286> themselves<WH2320>; in her month they shall find her<WH4672>.

Withhold<WH4513> your foot<WH7272> from being unshod<WH3182>, and your throat<WH1627> from thirst<WH6773>: but you said<WH559>, There is no hope<WH2976>: no<WH157>; for I have loved strangers<WH2114>, and after<WH310> them will I go<WH3212>.

As the thief<WH1590> is ashamed<WH1322> when he is found<WH4672>, so is the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478> ashamed<WH3001>; they<WH4428>, their kings, their princes<WH8269>, and their priests<WH3548>, and their prophets<WH5030>,

Saying<WH559> to wood<WH6086>, You are my father<WH1>; and to a stone<WH68>, You have brought me forth<WH3205>: for they have turned<WH6437> their back<WH6203> unto me<WH6440>, and not their face: but in the time<WH6256> of their trouble<WH7451> they will say<WH559>, Arise<WH6965>, and save us<WH3467>.

But where are your gods<WH430> that you have made<WH6213> you<WH6965>? let them arise, if they can save<WH3467> you in the time<WH6256> of your trouble<WH7451>: for according to the number<WH4557> of your cities<WH5892> are your gods<WH430>, O Judah<WH3063>.
Therefore will you plead<WH7378> with me<WH6586>? you all have transgressed against me<WH5002>, says the Lord<WH3068>.

In vain<WH7723> have I struck<WH5221> your sons<WH1121>; they received<WH3947> no correction<WH4148>: your own sword<WH2719> has devoured<WH398> your prophets<WH5030>, like a destroying<WH7843> lion<WH738>.

O generation<WH1755>, see<WH7200> you the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068>. Have I been a wilderness<WH4057> unto Israel<WH3478>? a land<WH776> of darkness<WH3991>? therefore say<WH559> my people<WH5971>, We are lords<WH7300>; we will come no more unto you<WH935>?
Can a maid<WH1330> forget<WH7911> her ornaments<WH5716>, or a bride<WH3618> her attire<WH7196>? yet my people<WH5971> have forgotten<WH7911> me days<WH3117> without number<WH4557>.
Why trim<WH3190> you your way<WH1870> to seek<WH1245> love<WH160>? therefore have you also taught<WH3925> the wicked ones<WH7451> your ways<WH1870>.
Also in your skirts<WH3671> is found<WH4672> the blood<WH1818> of the souls<WH5315> of the poor<WH34> innocents<WH5355>: I have not found<WH4672> it by secret search<WH4290>, but upon all these.
Yet you say<WH559>, Because I am innocent<WH5352>, surely his anger<WH639> shall turn<WH7725> from me<WH8199>. Behold, I will plead with you<WH559>, because you say, I have not sinned<WH2398>.
Why go about<WH235> so much<WH3966> to change<WH8138> your way<WH1870>? you also shall be ashamed<WH954> of Egypt<WH4714>, as you were ashamed<WH954> of Assyria<WH804>.
Yes<WH3318>, you shall go forth from him<WH3027>, and your hands upon your head<WH7218>: for the Lord<WH3068> has rejected<WH3988> your confidences<WH4009>, and you shall not prosper in them<WH6743>.
